text:
SeUJeI is twice as fast as Jocabi. 
This is true for every positive definite tridiagonal matrix: 1i,1"... for Gauss-Seidel 
is the square of 1,l"lmu for Jacobi. This holds in many other applications- but not 
for every matrix. Anything is possible when It is strongly nonsyrrunetric-Jacobi is 
som etimes better. and both methods might fail. Our examp le is small: 
The Gauss-Seidel eigenvalues are 0 and 1. Compare with ~ and -! for lacobi.
